title: Classical Ballet Teacher
description:
Are you passionate about teaching ballet and enjoy working with young, aspiring dancers? Join our team at the Scarsdale Ballet Studio (SBS), a well-established classical ballet school in our modern studios in White Plains, NY.

We are seeking two dedicated and exceptional Ballet Instructors, one to teach creative ballet to children 3-6 years old, and one to teach classical ballet techniques to students aged 12-18. As members of our faculty, you will play an important role in shaping the foundation of young dancers and inspiring their artistic journey.

Qualifications:

* Age Requirement: Applicants must be 18 years or older.
* Dance Expertise: A strong background in ballet with comprehensive training.
* Teaching Experience: Previous experience instructing ballet at the required level.
* Enthusiasm: A genuine passion for nurturing and developing young talent.
* Availability: Weekday afternoons, occasionally weekends.

Responsibilities:

* Lead engaging and age-appropriate create ballet classes
* Develop and execute lesson plans that blend creativity with classical ballet techniques.
* Foster a positive and encouraging learning environment for all students.
* Provide individualized attention and guidance to support each student's progress.
* Collaborate with fellow instructors and studio staff to enhance the overall dance program.

To apply, please submit your resume, outlining your dance and teaching experience, and your availability.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $55.00 - $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 6 per week

Schedule:

* After school
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Teaching: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Home Care Human Resources (HR)
description:
Floral Home Care a growing Home Health Care Agency located in the Bronx is looking to hire an experienced Bi Lingual Spanish speaking Human Resources ( HR) Coordinator.

**Responsibilities**:

* Ensure new hires and existing paraprofessional employees (HHA/PCA) are in compliance with DOH regulations including pre-employment physicals, annual updates, and in-service requirements.
* Process new applicants for employment as well as procure and authenticate documents required for employment such as I9.
* Enter compliance information into software system HHA exchange.
* Utilize software system HHA Exchange to track ongoing compliance via reporting tools.
* Ensure annual performance evaluations/supervisions are being performed for all paraprofessional employees.
* Coordinate and schedule on going in-service education for all paraprofessional employees.

**Job Requirements**:

* Knowledge of DOH regulations/guidelines relating to HHA/PCA employment requirements.
* Strong organizational skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Previous Human Resource (HR) Coordinator experience in a home care agency,
* Experience using HHA Exchange preferred
* Bi Lingual- Spanish speaking required

Good pay with lots of room for growth.

Please email your resume and we will be in contact with you.'

title: Cocktail Server
description:
Society Billiards + Bar is searching for a full-time cocktail server to join our growing team for the upcoming event season (not seasonal).

Society Billiards + Bar is an upscale billiards club located in the heart of the Flatiron where we specialize in providing our valued guests with a unique social experience.

We are looking for a friendly, hardworking, energetic and personable applicant who is dedicated to the hospitality business. Applicants should have basic cocktail/wine/beer knowledge with a natural ability to upsell. At least 1 year of cocktail serving experience required, with a self-starter and team player attitude.

As a server you will work in a cohesive team environment to provide a memorable gaming experience to guests through personalized service. We are not basic order takers, we take pride in knowing our members names and look forward to hosting guests in our establishment.

We offer awesome work perks including:

- complimentary gaming + employee discounts

- paid training, eligible for health insurance after 3 months of full time employment

- fun work environment where everyone knows your name!

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Group Fitness Instructor
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a dedicated and passionate Fitness Instructor to join our team. The ideal candidate will have an opportunity to obtain an Official Lagree certification which is needed to instruct and coach on the patented Megaformer. Must be able to create effective routines that cater to a diverse range of fitness levels., beginner to advanced. Our goal is to provide a safe, supportive, motivating and fun environment for our members to achieve their fitness goals.

Responsibilities:

-Must learn the science behind the Lagree method including the names and instructions of exercises.

- Design effective sequences ensuring that all classes are safe, challenging, and enjoyable for participants.

-Provide appropriate modifications and advancement as needed.  
- Provide expert guidance and coaching to members, including instruction on proper form, body mechanics, alignment and exercise techniques.

- Stay up-to-date on the latest exercise updates as we are always evolving.  
- Provide feedback and encouragement to help members reach their fitness goals.  
- Maintain clean and organized studio after teaching, returning all Megaformer straps and springs back to its original form.

Qualifications:

- A strong background in personal training, fitness instruction, or a related field.  
- Certification in a relevant fitness discipline, Pilates instructors are welcomed.  
- In-depth knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and body mechanics.  
- The ability to educate and motivate individuals of all fitness levels.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
-High energy individuals the ability to curate trending playlists.

Skills:  
- Strong understanding of anatomy and physiology.  
- Ability to educate and motivate others.  
- Experience with fitness instruction and personal training.  
- Knowledge of body mechanics and exercise techniques.  
- Certification in a relevant fitness discipline.

title: B2B Sales Assistant
description:
Winsor Consulting is looking for an Entry Level B2B Sales Assistant to join our team in our Piscataway office. The B2B Sales Assistant is responsible for prospecting sales and qualifying leads for new and existing accounts.

This person will act as a liaison between our marketing and sales teams. He/she will be naturally curious, results-driven, and eager to bring our product/services to new markets.

Responsibilities:

* **Contact and qualify leads** - Prospect new sales leads by making an initial phone or email contact. Engage the account and prepare them for the Account Executive. Connect with as many leads as possible to encourage the purchase of the product offered. Be the point person for your team's sales lead qualification process.
* **Manage current accounts** – Stay in close contact with existing accounts or leads and create brand awareness, educational opportunities, and request referrals. Coordinate in-person meetings and calls between the new clients and Account Executives.
* **Customer support** – Answer calls and emails from clients, identify the issue and make suggestions for future or new products or services.

Requirements:

* BS degree in Marketing or Business Administration is required
* Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls)
* Experience with CRM software
* Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts)
* Understanding of sales performance metrics

Our schedule is Monday to Friday 8AM - 5PM. We do come to the office on a daily basis. We would love to get to know you better and discuss your background and career.

ABOUT US:

Winsor Consulting is a new marketing and sales firm in the NJ area. We have been able to grow by 100% already in the 4th quarter of 2023 and are looking to add 5 new team members by the end of 2024. We represent different energy brokers in the NJ area and help our clients increase their profit sharing and decrease their overhead. Our aim is to continue to provide great client retention and customer satisfaction.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

* Paid training
* Travel reimbursement

* Monday to Friday

* Piscataway, NJ 08854 (Preferred)

title: Junior Account Manager
description:
Join our dynamic team at VillageCare as a Full-Time Junior Account Manager! This is an exciting opportunity for motivated individuals with a passion for vendor relations to showcase their skills and contribute to our growing organization. As a Junior Account Manager, you will have the chance to work through out the greater NYC area, collaborating and ensuring seamless communication with our referral sources.


With a competitive pay range of **$28-32/hr**, this role offers the perfect combination of responsibility and growth potential. If you are looking to kickstart your career in account management, this position is perfect for you. You will have benefits such as a generous PTO package, 10 Paid Holidays, Personal and Sick time, Medical/Dental/Vision, HRA/FSA, Education Reimbursement, Retirement Savings 403(b), Life and Disability, Commuter Benefits, Paid Family Leave, and Additional Employee Discounts.


Apply now and take the first step towards a rewarding career at VillageCare!

### **VILLAGECARE: WHO WE ARE**


VillageCare is a community-based, not-for-profit organization serving people with chronic care needs, as well as seniors and individuals in need of continuing care and managed care services. Our mission is to promote healing, better health and well-being to the fullest extent possible. Our care is offered through a comprehensive array of community and residential programs, as well as managed care. VillageCare has delivered quality health care services to individuals residing within New York City for over 45 years.

### **YOUR DAY TO DAY AS A JUNIOR ACCOUNT MANAGER**


As a Junior Account Manager at VillageCare, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining referring relationships with internal and external referral sources, contributing to the continuous growth of our organization. Your responsibilities will include daily interactions with community and provider referral sources, creating a robust pipeline of new sources, and effectively communicating data to maximize referral conversion rates. You will collaborate with leadership to manage outreach efforts efficiently, ensuring that all referral sources are kept up-to-date on the progress of their referrals. Reporting outreach productivity weekly, you will also be involved in marketing initiatives such as events, presentations, and fairs. This position offers specific projects and goals, allowing for some autonomy in decision-making while providing readily available supervision for guidance and support.


Join us and make a difference in the healthcare industry with VillageCare!

### **WHAT MATTERS MOST**


To excel as a Junior Account Manager at VillageCare, candidates must demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build and maintain relationships effectively. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential for daily interactions with internal and external referral sources. The ideal candidate should be highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously. Proficiency in utilizing various software and tools, along with a valid driver's license and personal vehicle, is required for traveling to different boroughs within the greater NYC area to meet with referral sources. A proactive and results-driven mindset, coupled with the willingness to adapt to a fast-paced environment, are key attributes needed to succeed in this role.

### **ARE YOU READY FOR AN EXCITING OPPORTUNITY?**


We believe in taking care of our team, both on and off the job. That's why we offer a mobile-friendly application process - because we know your time is valuable. If you're ready to take your management skills to the next level and join a team that values hard work and good times, complete our application today!
company_description: VillageCare provides care and services for more than 12,000 unique individuals annually through its residential and community programs.

title: Assistant Boutique Manager - Meatpacking District NYC
description:
Retail Luxury Goods and Jewelry


**Position** **Summary:**


The Assistant Boutique Manager shares responsibility with the Boutique Manager business development and assists in overall management of the boutique, staff, merchandise and customer experience. The Assistant Boutique Manager will also assist in achieving sales objectives, building highly motivated teams and helping to develop the sales team.

 **Essential Duties & Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):**

**Sales/Customer Service**

* Maintain floor coverage to support sales team in providing a luxury experience for customers. Set an example through client interactions and ensure highest level of service exists in order to meet or exceed store goals
* Partner with Boutique Manager to monitor performance goals and continually make necessary adjustments to meet or exceed goals.
* Address and successfully resolve client situations according to company standards. Escalate client issues to Boutique Manager as needed.
* Initiate and leverage sales opportunities with existing and prospective customers while developing and maintaining clients
* Support sales associates in Breitling “Sales Techniques and Service” and clienteling skill development
* Develop strong product knowledge as well as company history, information and news knowledge to be able to communicate to both customers and the team.
* Knowledgeable in current industry trends and technology including familiarity of competition.
* Maintain a professional appearance and behavior and follow the Breitling dress code standards
* Support all company initiates as they relate to product launches, customer service and selling

**Leadership**

* Take full responsibility for the boutique in the absence of the Boutique Manager
* Leading by example, ensure a positive and professional team environment that promotes trust, integrity and superior performance standards
* Foster a positive working environment that encourages diversity, mutual respect and teamwork
* Hold coaching sessions with sales team to review performance and provide timely feedback in partnership with Boutique Manager
* Support and assist in the development of sales team to ensure achievement of company standards
* Assist Boutique Manager in resolving employee issues in a professional manner and in accordance to company guidelines

**Store Operations**

* Maintain thorough understanding of all company policies, procedures and processes. Ensure team adherence to company and security policies and procedures at all times
* Maintain inventory accuracy and shrink within company standards by regular follow ups with Boutique Manager/Corporate and executing initiatives as needed
* Support Boutique Manager in managing daily store operations
* Manage timekeeping and payroll with final approval of Boutique Manager
* Assist Boutique Manager in preparing and executing special events and community initiatives that promote sales development in compliance with company guidelines
* Assist in overseeing the repair process to insure increased client follow-up and timely resolution of issues
* Other special projects and responsibilities as assigned

**Visual Merchandising**

* Assist in maintaining visual standards with direction from corporate and management

**Team Relations**

* Maintain open, professional and ongoing communications with store management, peers and corporate
* Be a positive role model and represent the brand appropriately at all times
* Adapt to changing needs of the brand and company
* Where requested, partner with Boutique Manager to successfully on board new hires including training on company processes, policies and procedures, company philosophy and heritage and product etc.
* Ensure fair and effective scheduling of sales team to support business needs and maximize productivity

 **Skills, Knowledge and Personal Attributes Required:**

* Minimum of 3 years experience in retail required
* Previous experience in high end watch sales preferred
* Strong organization, communication and follow-up skills are essential
* Excellent communication, verbal and written skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Results oriented and self-motivated individual who is able to achieve goals defined by management
* Highly flexible and able to work as part of a team in a demanding environment
* Ability to understand sales, budgets, goals and scheduling
* Computer proficiency a must

 **Salary Range:** $70-80 yearly

title: Administrative Assistant (Bilingual-Spanish) - Healing Grounds Wellness Center
description:
Administrative Assistant (Bilingual-Spanish) - Healing Grounds Wellness Center
The mission of Healing Grounds Wellness Center, LLC is to provide a warm, compassionate, and safe environment where diverse individuals from any ethnicity can find the true freedom to wholeness. Our approach is holistic: body, mind, physical and spiritual. Although all counseling services are clinical based, applicant must be open and/or respectful to spirituality as clients may request services for Christian counseling.


The organization is currently looking for a full-time administrative assistant (Bilingual- Spanish Speaking). Must live in NJ, PA or close by to office. This position will require great communication with prospective clients in need of counseling and scheduling current clients, communicating with health care professionals, handling all clinician's schedule, along with engaging in daily general administrative duties.


**Those pursuing a Psychology, Social work or Social services degree are highly encouraged to apply.**

**Requirements:**

**Other Requirements:**

title: Next Gen Children's Pastor - Bridge Community Church
description:
Next Gen Children's Pastor - Bridge Community Church
Bridge Community is a Contemporary, Non-Denominational church in Floral Park, NY, which sits on the border of Queens and Long Island. In response to continued growth, the church is seeking an Associate Pastor to oversee the Next Gen Ministries, with a primary focus on kids in Grades Pre-K to 5th Grade.


Bridge Vision - Bridge Community Church exists to connect people with Jesus and with each other.
  

Bridge Mission - Bridge is a local church that serves the community, values diversity, has a heart for worship, is active in mission, and promotes growth in the Word and in discipleship. Job Description: Next Gen Ministries Pastor


Reports to: Lead Pastor


Purpose: The Next Gen Pastor is responsible for providing ministerial leadership for the next generation of leaders, primarily focusing on Pre-K to 5th Grade (Bridge Kidz) ministries. This candidate will work with families, church leadership, and the community to engage children and young people and help the children grow the relationship with Jesus. A candidate who has earned, or is pursuing, a degree in ministry related fields and/or has ministry experience, and a true heart for Youth is preferred.


Qualifications:


* + Demonstrates a strong, vibrant, and growing relationship with Jesus Christ seeking to become more Christ-like daily.
* + Demonstrates a strong ability to relate to children, students, parents, staff, and congregation.
* + Demonstrates a passion for God’s Word and the Gospel.
* + Demonstrates a passion for Next Gen ministry.
* + Strong ability to teach the Bible to children and students, while evangelizing and discipling the children.
* + Strong ability to lead, communicate, plan, organize and delegate effectively.
* + Ability to develop and work within ministry teams.
* + Ability to develop and nurture relationships with all adults in the church.
* + Being musically talented is a plus.
* + Being married is a plus.Ministry Responsibilities:
* + Provide innovative and creative leadership for next gen ministries.
* + Develop and oversee age-appropriate programs, events, and activities.
* + Ability to plan and execute church and outreach events.
* + Provide opportunities for families to connect, grow, and serve together.
* + Recruit, screen, and equip volunteers to effectively serve.
* + Complete other ministry tasks across all of the church as required by the Lead Pastor.
* + Recruit, train, and lead a team of volunteers to effectively run youth ministries.
* + Utilize modern technology and social media platforms to connect with and engage the next generation.
* + Provide training opportunities for volunteers and leaders within the next gen ministries.
* + Stay informed about current trends, issues, and challenges faced by the youth and young adults, adapting ministrystrategies accordingly.


Salary & Schedule/Responsibilities:


This Associate Pastor position is full-time. Work hours are a minimum of 40-hours per week but may extend depending upon the needs of the ministry. The duties of this position require to be on site with flexibility for off-site work as appropriate under the circumstances.
* Salary: $45,000 to $48,000 depending on experience.
* + Supplemental stipend for: Cell Phone, Gas, Travel for work related activities
* + One weekday off per week, excluding days with special events and services.
* + Multiple evenings a week will be necessary on a seasonal basis.
* + Weekend Schedule: Attend and serve at all worship and special services, including whole-church events, outreachevents, etc.
* + Attend regular Ministry and leadership meetings.
* + Keep the Lead Pastor apprised of all ministries’ activities.
* + Keep accurate records and regularly report activities, achievements, and needs of the ministries to the Board.
* + Manage an annual budget reflective of the goals and objectives of the ministries.
* + Assist in daily/weekly tasks as needed to maintain standard operations of the church.
* + Demonstrate personal integrity and a high standard of ethics in all areas of ministry.

title: Director of Kids Ministry - Grand Point Church
description:
Director of Kids Ministry - Grand Point Church
The role of the Director of Kids Ministry is to provide overall direction of the Kids Ministries of all Grand Point Church (GPC) campuses for children age birth through 5th grade. This role will develop a ministry plan that is consistent with all GPC ministries and the mission, vision, and values of GPC.


**Duties & Responsibilities:**

The Director of Kids Ministry will be responsible for the following:


**Leadership & Campus Collaboration**

* + Provide vision and oversight for the future of KidsPoint programming at GPC.
	+ Directly responsible for the supervision of the Kids Ministries Assistant Director and all the GPC campus Kids Ministries Leads.
	+ Coordinate with all GPC Kids Ministry Leads on calendar specific events and programs.
	+ Collaborate with all GPC Kids Ministry Leads on planning, execution, and evaluation of the kid’s ministry for GPC.
* **Discipleship:**
	+ Be a leader of leaders for the Kids Ministry of GPC.
	+ Execute a leadership development pipeline that equips and trains adult leaders to effectively reach and disciple children.
	+ Direct a leadership team for planning and executing the GPC Kids Ministry philosophy.
	+ Utilize the gifting and skills of the Kids Ministry volunteers to carry out programming.
* **Oversight of All GPC Kids Ministries**
	+ Ensure cohesion in content and vision for GPC Kids Ministry across all campuses.
	+ Recruit, train, and develop the leadership and volunteers required to keep GPC Kids Ministries moving forward at all campuses.
	+ Develop age-appropriate ministries to reach and disciple kids in the church and community.
	+ Develop and promote vital small group and large group programming for the kids of GPC.
	+ Develop a transition plan from each age group toward the next step in Kids Ministry.Create and develop partnerships in the community to connect and reach children.
	+ Be concerned with the spiritual development of the Kids Point volunteers ensuring they know they are valued beyond the service ability.
* **Strategic Planning:**
	+ Collaborate with the Director of Youth Ministries to provide a program of Biblically based curriculum to lead students to a better connection with Jesus while teaching them the facets of God’s Word.
	+ Plan and execute GPC kids’ events including those welcoming the children within our communities.
* **Administrative and Reporting:**
	+ Prepare and submit a monthly department report to be presented as part of a larger report to the Elders.
	+ Oversee the Kids Ministry budget for all the campuses.
	+ Complete a monthly credit card detail report for expenses.
* **Team Collaboration:** Each member of the GPC staff will work as a team to accomplish the mission of Grand Point Church. This may include duties outside the normal realm of the position but are imperative to the fulfillment of our objectives as a whole.
**Qualifications/Requirements**

* 5+ years’ experience serving as a director in kids’ ministry.
* A vibrant and growing relationship with Jesus Christ
* Passion for serving kids in a full-time ministry capacity.
* Good interpersonal skills that reach across generational barriers in order to provide a successful ministry to kids.
* Experience leading & shepherding others effectively with a strong emphasis on shepherding children, youth, and families.
* Possesses a wide knowledge of all the aspects of kids’ ministry and is capable of casting vision.
* Thrives in a team environment, including staff, Elders, and volunteers.
* Experience recruiting and leading volunteers in a ministry setting.
* Should maintain regular service attendance at the GPC campus.

title: Buyer/Purchasing Specialist
description:
**About us**

ATM KICKS LLC, founded in 2021, is a rapidly growing company in the wholesale sneaker and fashion industry. We specialize in providing high-quality sneakers and fashion clothing and footwear to retailers and bulk purchasers. With our dedication to quality and customer satisfaction, we aim to become a leading name in the industry.

**Position Summary:**

We are looking for an experienced and strategic Buyer/Purchasing Specialist to manage our product procurement and purchasing planning. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a strong ability to negotiate prices, and the capacity to work closely with our sales team to forecast and plan upcoming product purchases.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute purchasing strategies in alignment with sales forecasts and market trends.
* Communicate and negotiate with vendors to secure the best prices and terms.
* Collaborate with the sales team to plan and determine product needs for upcoming months and seasons.
* Source products from a diverse range of vendors to ensure a variety of high-quality offerings.
* Manage budgets and monitor expenses to ensure cost-effective purchasing.
* Maintain and update records of purchased products, delivery information, and inventory levels.
* Stay informed on industry trends and market conditions to make informed purchasing decisions.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors and suppliers.
* Provide regular reports and updates on purchasing activities and market insights to management.

**Qualifications:**

* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Strong teamwork skills and ability to work closely with the sales team.
* Proven experience in sourcing and purchasing from various vendors.
* Good budget management skills and experience in financial planning.
* Experience working in large companies or with significant purchasing responsibilities is a plus.
* Knowledge of the sneaker industry is a plus.
* Bilingual abilities are a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field is preferred.

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and interest in the role to hello@atmkicks.com.

Pay: $45,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

* Lyndhurst, NJ 07071 (Preferred)

title: CDPAP Marketer
description:
**Homecare Patient Recruiter**

Eprine Home Care seeks an experience and motivated CDPAP marketer to work in our home care agency, recruiting individuals in need of home care services. Should have knowledge of:

Medicaid and MLTC eligibility including EPaces, Maximus procedures, and MLTC enrollment. The Homecare patient recruiter is responsible for processing referrals which includes accurate data entry and active follow-ups.

**Duties:**

* 5 start of care per month.
* Work with community-based organizations to recruit persons needing home care services
* Generate referrals for home health by building relationships with physicians, long-term care, independent and assisted living facilities and other community resources.
* Develop, establish and maintain relationships with major referral sources,

(e.g. hospitals, assistant living facilities, rehab centers, hospice, and other health care provider professionals)

* Build and maintain relationships with contract referral sources.
* Conduct large group and one-on-one presentations on various topics as necessary. These presentations must be directed to referral sources or direct consumers/Patients
* Conduct research on new and untapped referral sources
* Conduct individual/group presentations for health care professionals, seniors and others in order to reach Medicaid eligible home care patients.
* Understanding of MCO, MLTC and related insurance eligibility requirements
* Ensure the Agency receives authorization for MLTC cases and provide case specifics to Agency's HHA Coordination Department
* Generate home care patient referrals from existing and potential accounts
* Process referrals, which include accurate data entry and active follow-ups and obtain necessary information for patient admission.
* Weekly meeting with owner to discuss sales progress and upcoming marketing meetings for all referral sources.
* Develop alliances with hospitals, senior centers, rehab centers
* Ability to work with local community based organizations
* Maintain all logs & reports associated with the Marketing/ Intake Patient

**About the Opportunity:**

This role is perfect for those who value independence and are eager to make a significant impact in a growing company.

**What We Offer:**

* **Highly Competitive Compensation**: up to $500.00 after 5 start of care for the month.
* **Growth and Financial Success**: This position is great opportunity for someone who's truly motivated and have the tenacity for success.
* **Flexible Consulting**: You have the freedom to set your own schedule, allowing you to work in a way that best suits your lifestyle.
* Fieldwork Engagement: This role requires active engagement in the field, connecting directly with clients and community partners, and offering a hands-on approach to building relationships and expanding our network.
* **Impactful Work:** Your efforts directly contribute to the expansion of our agency and the well-being of individuals needing home care services.

**Your Role**:

As a Homecare patient recruiter, your responsibilities include:

* Guiding clients through Medicaid and MLTC eligibility with your expertise.
* Managing referrals efficiently, ensuring detailed follow-up.
* Establishing and maintaining productive relationships with healthcare providers and community organizations.
* Using your independent judgment to contribute effectively to our agency’s goals.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $55,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* homecare Marketing: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**Customer Service Representative**
-----------------------------------


Are you a people person? Do you love helping others? U-Haul is in search of friendly, motivated people for the position of Customer Service Representative. As a Customer Service Representative, you will work as part of a supportive team to be the face of U-Haul company’s exceptional service and ensuring that customers get all the help they need on their journeys by inspecting and maintaining equipment. As well as assisting customers, using up-to-date technology to dispatch and return equipment. This position offers on-the-job education.


Our motto is “**Hire Fast, Pay Fast**." You can start today and get paid today! Schedule a hands-on working interview and get paid for it. We also offer a **$100 hiring bonus!** In addition, we offer a **$300 cash bonus**, paid immediately upon completion of U-Haul Equipment Inspection and Verification through our 1-2-3 Punch Certification Program at retail stores.

**U-Haul Offers:**

* Career stability
* Opportunities for advancement
* Mindset App Reimbursement
* Gym Reimbursement Program
* Health insurance & Prescription plans, if eligible
* Paid holidays, vacation, and sick days, if eligible
* Life insurance
* MetLaw Legal program
* MetLife auto and home insurance
* Discounts on Apple products, Dell computers, cell phone plans, hotels, and more
* 401(k) Savings Plan
* Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
* 24-hour physician available for kids
* Dental & Vision Plans
* Business travel insurance
* You Matter EAP
* LifeLock Identity Theft Protection
* Critical Illness/Group Accident Insurance
* Dave Ramsey’s SmartDollar Program

**Customer Service Representative** **Responsibilities:**

* Assist customers inside and outside a U-Haul center with U-Haul products and services.
* Use smartphone-based U-Scan technology to manage rentals and inventory.
* Move and hook up U-Haul trucks and trailers.
* Clean and inspect equipment on the lot including checking fluid levels.
* Answer questions and educate customers regarding products and services.
* Prepare rental invoices and accept equipment returned from rental.
* Install hitches and trailer wiring.
* Fill propane (certification offered through U-Haul upon employment)
* Drive a forklift (certification offered through U-Haul upon employment)
* Other duties as assigned
* Participate in ongoing continuous U-Haul education through U-Haul University.

**Customer Service Representative** **Minimum Qualifications:**

* Valid driver’s license and ability to maintain a good driving record
* High school diploma or equivalent

**Work Environment:**


The work involves moderate risks or discomforts which require special safety precautions, e.g., working around moving parts or machines, fumes or irritant chemicals. May be required to use protective clothing or gear such as masks, goggles, gloves or shields.

**Physical Demands:**


The work requires some physical exertion such as long periods of remaining stationary, moving around indoors and outdoors, positioning oneself to reach objects at varying heights and moving equipment weighing a minimum of 50 lbs. assisted or unassisted.


Pay Range is: $15.00 - $28.60 Hourly  

  

  

U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state, or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.


  
### **About Us**


Since 1945, U-Haul has been serving do-it-yourself movers and their households. Like many other successful ventures, the concept for U-Haul was generated out of need. After World War II, there existed the widespread need for do-it-yourself moving equipment that would be available on a one-way, nationwide basis.


U-Haul co-founders L.S. "Sam" Shoen and his wife, Anna Mary Carty Shoen, recognized that need and acted upon it. Their visionary approach spread the cost of ownership among many users, facilitating the mobility of the populations of the U.S. and Canada. The covered wagon of the pioneers morphed into orange U-Haul trailers. In the process, an industry was born.


U-Haul Holding Company and its family of companies, including U-Haul, have strived to create a culture of health and wellness. As of February 1, 2020, and consistent with applicable law, no U-Haul Holding Company or its family of companies will hire individuals in states where it may lawfully decline to hire individuals who use nicotine products (Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia and Washington). This policy will not apply to team members hired before February 1, 2020.
company_description: Get your career moving with the world’s largest do-it-yourself moving and self-storage company. Based in Phoenix, AZ, U-Haul has locations in all 50 states and 13 Canadian Provinces and Territories.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
Job Summary:

Join our team at Birdbox as a Host/Hostess and be part of an exciting and fast paced environment dedicated to providing exceptional take out experience. We are seeking a passionate individual with a strong background in hospitality and customer service to ensure our guests receive top-notch service from the moment they arrive.

Responsibilities:

**⁠ ⁠Greet and welcome guests with a friendly and professional demeanor**

**⁠ ⁠Take orders and help customers place orders**

**⁠ ⁠Assist in maintaining an organized front-of-house area**

**⁠ ⁠Communicate effectively with guests to understand their needs and provide assistance**

**⁠ ⁠Collaborate with the kitchen team to ensure smooth operations during peak hours**

**Controlling crowed, ensuring the kitchen isn’t overwhelmed with orders, ensuring only the right number of orders are placed so we don’t sell more than we have stock of**

**⁠ ⁠Uphold high standards of guest relations and hospitality at all times**

**⁠ ⁠Answer phone calls and handle inquiries with professionalism and courtesy**

**⁠ ⁠Support kitchen staff by coordinating menu availability and managing guest flow**

**⁠ ⁠Assist in resolving any guest concerns or issues promptly and effectively**

Requirements:

**⁠ ⁠Previous experience in a restaurant or hospitality setting is preferred**

**⁠ ⁠Excellent communication skills with a focus on guest relations**

**⁠ ⁠Strong understanding of food service procedures and customer service principles**

**⁠ ⁠Proficient in phone etiquette and handling inquires effectively**

**⁠ ⁠Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude**

**⁠ ⁠Attention to detail and the ability to multitask efficiently**

**⁠ ⁠Must be reliable, team-oriented, and willing to learn and grow in the role**

Join our team at Birdbox as a Host/Host, where you will have the opportunity to showcase your hospitality skills, work closely with a dedicated team, and contribute to creating memorable takeout experiences for our guests. Competitive compensation based on experience is offered along with opportunities for career advancement within our organization. If you are passionate about hospitality and customer service, we invite you to apply now by submitting your resume for consideration.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
We are looking for a Full Time Receptionist to manage our front desk on a daily basis and to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. As a Receptionist, you will be the first point of contact for our company.

To be successful as a Receptionist, you should have a pleasant personality, as this is also a customer service role. You should be able to deal with emergencies in a timely and effective manner, while streamlining office operations. Multitasking and stress management skills are essential for this position.

This role may require working in shifts, so flexibility is a plus.

Ultimately, a Receptionist’s duties and responsibilities are to ensure the front desk welcomes guests positively, and executes all administrative tasks to the highest quality standards.

Responsibilities:

* Greet and welcome guests as soon as they arrive
* Direct visitors to the appropriate Glaminator
* Answer, screen and forward incoming phone calls
* Ensure reception area is tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, forms and brochures)
* Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email
* Receive, sort and distribute daily mail/deliveries
* Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk (monitor logbook, issue visitor badges)
* Order front office supplies and keep inventory of stock Skills
* Proficient in Millenium software a plus

title: Games Attendant-HB Leisure at LEGOLAND New York
description:
**HB Leisure** is the leading attraction partner for skill games and amusements around the world **operating in over 100 theme parks across 25 countries**. Working for HB Leisure is a great place for a first-time job seeker or a place to build an exciting career. Our employees are empowered to provide great service through cross-training in a variety of different positions. Many of our managers were promoted from within! At the heart of our success is Great Games, Great Prizes and Great People.


If a desk isn’t for you, then you are for us, so why don't you join us working in a **fun theme park environment** and **develop skills** that will be recognized throughout your career!


As a **Games Attendant**, you will be responsible for running our skill games whilst delivering excellent customer service to our guests and ensuring that they have as much fun as possible playing our games!

**Working at HB Leisure, you will have access to amazing perks to include:**

* Flexible schedules
* Career advancement and promotion opportunities.
* Free park admission and discounts
* Opportunity to interact with people from all over the world

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Work various games of chance and skill.
* Interact with guests and entice them to play a game; explaining rules of play, handling payment and giving out prizes.
* Maintain cleanliness and appearance of games unit and surrounding area.
* Follow park policies and procedures, including those related to safety and emergency situations.
* Visual merchandising of stock to increase interest and excitement and maintain inventory of prizes
* Must be able to work weekends and holidays.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Ability to work and interact with people from diverse backgrounds.
* Good judgment and commitment to safety.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Energetic and enthusiastic personality.
* Availability to include weekdays, weekends, evenings, and holidays.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**

* Continually required to stand
* Continually required to walk
* Continually required to utilize hand and finger dexterity
* Continually required to talk or hear
* Continually exposure to wet and/or humid conditions (non-weather)
* Continually exposure to outside weather conditions
* Continually exposure to extreme heat or cold (non-weather)
* Frequently required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crawl
* Occasionally required to lift/push/carry items up to 25 pounds
* Occasionally required to sit
* Occasionally utilize visual acuity to operate equipment, read technical information, or use a keyboard
* Occasionally work in high, precarious places
* Occasional exposure to loud noise


HB Leisure (HBL) is the world's leading attraction partner skill games and amusements. Established in 1927, HBL operates in over 100 sites and in 25 countries across the globe.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.

*HB Leisure is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not make employment decisions based on an individual's race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status, and we comply with all laws concerning nondiscriminatory employment practices. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for employees and job applicants with disabilities. Our management team is dedicated to ensuring fulfillment of this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, associate activities and general treatment during employment.*

*We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.*

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
***Kidz Choice Services***is a private agency providing ABA Therapy to children with Autism and other Developmental Disabilities within the home, school, and community settings.

We are currently seeking Board Certified Behavior Analysts and/or NYS Licensed Behavior Analysts to provide direct therapy for a student in Manhattan. Individuals holding NYS Limited Permits are also encouraged to apply! We will provide the necessary supervision.

* **Location: New York, NY (W179th St)**
* Schedule: Mon-Fri 3-5pm
* Rate: $150/hour

**Responsibilities include:**

* Developing individualized programs designed to increase adaptive functioning and academic skills
* Conducting FBAs and developing BIPs (as needed)
* Supervising behavioral technicians and providing overall case management (e.g. progress monitoring, home/school visits, provider coverage, etc.)
* Working as part of a team
* Providing parent/family training

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Candidates should possess a BCBA and/or NYS LBA (NYS LP-LBA Ok!)
* Must demonstrate knowledge of cultural diversity and sensitivity
* Must be a team player, and open to working with a dynamic group of professionals

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $150.00 per hour

Expected hours: 6 – 10 per week

* Day shift

title: Assistant Baker/Cake Decorator
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled Cake Decorator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating visually appealing and delicious baked goods, with a focus on cake decorating. This role requires attention to detail, creativity, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

We are seeking an experienced baker with at least one year of previous experience in a bakery. You will be responsible for opening and closing the bakery some mornings and evenings, baking fresh menu items, setting out the pastries and preparing pastries and other baked goods for the following day. It is also the baker's responsibility to ensure the quality of the goods being used is up to par and make note of when supplies are running low so that an order can be made. Cake decorating experience is preferred. Examples of work will be requested.

Responsibilities:

- Prepare and decorate cakes for various events, including weddings, birthdays, and corporate functions.  
- Bake and frost cakes according to recipes and presentation requirements.  
- Use specialized tools and techniques to create intricate designs and patterns on cakes.  
- Ensure all cakes are presented to the highest standard and meet our food safety and quality control guidelines.  
- Package and transport cakes to clients, ensuring they arrive on time and in perfect condition.  
- Provide excellent customer service and ensure client satisfaction with our products and services.  
- Collaborate with other team members to develop new cake designs and flavors.  
- Maintain a clean and organized workspace, adhering to food handling and production standards.

Requirements:

- Experience in cake decorating or a related field, such as pastry or baking.  
- Knowledge of food production and food safety procedures.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.  
- Strong attention to detail and creativity in cake decorating.  
- Excellent customer service and communication skills.  
- Ability to lift and transport heavy objects, including cakes and decorations.  
- Familiarity with food handling and packaging practices.  
- Willingness to learn new techniques and recipes.  
- Certification in food handling and safety is preferred.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 32 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Food provided
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Store discount
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Afternoon shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Every weekend
* Morning shift

Ability to Commute:

* Rockaway Beach, NY 11693 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Rockaway Beach, NY 11693: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Host/Hostess
description:
TerraSole Ristorante in Ridgefield, CT is seeking a friendly and organized Host/Host. As the first point of contact for our guests, you will play a crucial role in providing excellent customer service and creating a positive dining experience.

* You will be required to:

Greet guests with a warm welcome and seat them at their tables  
Provide menus  
Manage reservations  
Take phone reservations and address guest inquiries  
Collaborate with servers to ensure smooth service flow

Previous experience is preferred

Schedule is Friday and Saturday nights, Holidays except (Thanksgiving and Christmas day) and certain week nights as needed. If interested please respond and include any relevant experience.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
As a Host/Hostess you'll ensure each customer has a wonderful experience dining with us! You will greet (both arriving and departing) and seat all guests in a friendly manner and assists in maintaining the overall guest flow of the restaurant.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Opens door for guests arriving and departing.
* Accommodates any special needs of guests, i.e., boosters, highchairs, disabilities.
* Manages the Wait List when the restaurant is full.
* Provides guest assistance to servers as needed.
* Maintains a clean and organized work area and completes cleaning as assigned

 **Benefits of working at IHOP include:**

* Health Insurance 90 days into employment
* Competitive Wages
* Awesome, team oriented environment
* Opportunities for growth and development
**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

+ Communicate in a friendly and courteous manner to guests & employees.
+ Maintains a clean and safe work area.
+ Performs daily, weekly, and monthly cleaning tasks assigned by management.

  

Since 1958, IHOP® has been the place where people connect over breakfast, enjoy study breaks, grab a bite before or after sporting events, and so much more. And no matter what menu items they order, there’s one ingredient that’s always constant — a smile. We’ve seen millions of smiles over the years in our restaurants, and now shared in photos across our social properties. In fact, smiles are so much a part of our culture that we changed our logo to include one.
company_description: For 65 years and counting, we’ve been delivering more joy to more people in our restaurants and on-the-go.

title: Servers
description:
As a server you are to prepare the dining room, including all necessary cleaning projects for service; serve customers in a professional, efficient and courteous manner. You MUST work as a team player to take orders, set tables, and serve tables, clear tables.

* Take orders for patrons for food and beverage.
* Serve food and beverage to patrons as requested in a timely manners.
* Check with customers to ensure that they are enjoying their meals and take actions to correct any problems.

* Perform the steps of service in a friendly and professional manner.

title: Dishwasher
description:
As a Dishwasher at IHOP, you will be responsible for the overall cleanliness of our restaurant! This includes:

* Washing dishes
* Sets and resets dining room tables
* Reseting tables according to specifications of restaurant
* Maintaining service stations in a clean and orderly manner throughout shift.
* Performing all opening and closing side work as required
* Performing additional responsibilities including cleaning restrooms, taking out trash, mopping floors and other assorted cleaning duties

**Benefits of working at IHOP include:**

title: Front End Entry Level
description:
**A Day in the Life:** 

When you begin your job with us working on the front-end as a courtesy clerk, customer service associate, or cashier, you are taking a step towards an opportunity that can help you learn, grow, and even develop a long-lasting career! We know you're choosing to invest your time with us, and we are committed to doing the same for you through on-the-job and online learning opportunities! Whether you are here for your first job or your last, from groceries to health needs, you guide, inspire, and make all customers' visit memorable. We build belonging by creating a diverse and inclusive workforce so, if you have smiles to share, we'd love to have you on our team.  



**What you bring to the table:**

* You take pride in the work you do, whether big or small.
* You believe that food is central to all our lives.
* Helping customers and fellow associates gives you energy.
* Smiling and making others smile is your favorite.
* You are eager, willing, and wanting to learn & grow.
* You believe that being a part of your community matters.

**Why you will choose us:**

Albertsons Companies Inc. has always been a people-oriented business, and thoughtful people practices remain a core element of our company’s philosophy. Our goal is to continue to bring people together around the joys of food and to inspire well-being and that starts with people like you bringing your unique self to our company and making it one person stronger and better!


We also provide a variety of benefits including:


* Diverse & Inclusive Work Culture
* Competitive Wages Paid Weekly
* Flexible work schedules
* Associate discounts
* Leaders invested in your training, career growth & development.
* Health and welfare benefits for eligible employees (Medical, Dental, 401k and more!)
* Vacation / Paid Time Off

**Our Values**

* We put people first.
* We are customer driven.
* We value different perspectives.
* We raise the bar.
* We act as owners.
* We are one team.
* We build belonging.
* We are committed to a healthy future.

  
**About Us:**

Albertsons Companies is committed to bringing people together around the joys of food and to inspire well-being by transforming the grocery and pharmacy-health experience for our customers. Each day, we work to earn customers for life.  



Albertsons Companies is a leading food and drug retailer in the United States. The Company operated 2,271 retail stores with 1,722 pharmacies, 401 associated fuel centers, 22 dedicated distribution centers and 19 manufacturing facilities. The Company operates stores across 34 states and the District of Columbia with 24 banners including Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. The Company is committed to helping people across the country live better lives by making a meaningful difference, neighborhood by neighborhood. In 2022, along with the Albertsons Companies  



Foundation, the Company contributed more than $200 million in food and financial support, including more than $40 million through our Nourishing Neighbors Program to ensure those living in our communities and those impacted by disasters have enough to eat.  



**Disclaimer**

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by the employees assigned to this job and are not the official job description for the position. All employees must comply with Company, Division, and Store policies and applicable laws. The responsibilities, duties, and skills of personnel may vary within store and/or from store to store and the official job description will be provided during the application process.  



**Albertsons is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

This Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, or on any other basis prohibited by law. Consistent with applicable state and local law, the Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  



We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at 1-888-255-2269(option #4).
company_description: Albertsons Companies is a team of more than 300,000 associates who support each other and appreciate the skills and passion each person brings to our Company.
